channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Crossing at the corner of carlton vale and cambrige road nw6, 22nd June
item.description:
Large pot holes directly after the speed bump after cambrige road insection heading east along cartton vale after. It is a hazard. Tarmac being compressed by car tyres 2 x indentations in the road approx 60cm wide and getting deeper. Looks of cars scape their bumpers and underside.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Carlton Vale, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish left by rough sleeper, 22nd June
item.description:
Carboard and general food waste containers left under the arch opposite the Vault café. please be aware there may also be drug paraphernalia within the rubbish. This was left by two rough sleepers who appeared to be taking illegal substances. They have now vacated the area with the majority of their belongings and have not been back for some time.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shad Thames, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: E-Bike Parking Station, 22nd June
item.description:
I am writing to raise a concern about the recent conversion of a car parking bay turned into an e-bike parking station on Ingestre Place Soho. While I understand the push for sustainable transport, this specific spot has become problematic. E-bikes are frequently left scattered around the area, not properly docked. It creates obstructions on the pavement, making it difficult for pedestrians, disabled residents and vehicles to drive through. I kindly request this spot to be converted completely to a double yellow line, as it already is a double yellow area after the E-bikes spot.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ingestre Place, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipped couch and office desk plus shelves., 22nd June
item.description:
Please remove a 2 seat couch, cushions, office desk with shelf unit from outside Trinity Court, Sydenham Park, near corner of Sydenham Park Road, flytipped Saturday.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sydenham Park, Forest Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Posing a serious accessibility and safety concern, 22nd June
item.description:
A number of bikes are currently blocking the entire street and pedestrian crossing at 124 Albany street - NW1 4EL. This obstruction is particularly dangerous as it prevents people using wheelchairs or other mobility aids from crossing safely, posing a serious accessibility and safety concern. I kindly ask that this issue is investigated and resolved as soon as possible. Many thanks,

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albany Street, Fitzrovia, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Grafitti, 21st June
item.description:
Grafitti on the paving in front of the bench (which is on/in Beckenham Green , 6 metres from the lampost.) Also, there is a yellow plastic sticker on the bench, which will need a scraper/blade to remove the sticker. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albemarle Road, Beckenham, London

item.title: Road obstruction, 21st June
item.description:
Pirana restaurant number 7-9 st James street security guards placing multiple cones on the road. And those cones blocking the road and causing a lot of traffic and car horn noise…And placing multiple cones on the free parking spaces. They don’t allow public to park the car where they supposed to park . They abuse the public and forcing them to not park the car unless they take money whichever not legal to do that .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, St. James's Street, Mayfair, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cressfield Rd/Grafton Road junction, 21st June
item.description:
CCTV has still not been replaced since report on 10 April 7416977. Vehicles are still driving through the no entry signs putting cyclists who do not expect to experience vehicles at risk of injury. If an accident happens here, the Council will be responsible as the problem was reported over 2 months ago.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 234, Grafton Road, Gospel Oak, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 117 Chetwynd Road, 21st June
item.description:
Overgrown hedge blocking pavement. Section 154 of The Highways Act 1980 stipulates that where overhanging hedges, trees or shrubs endangers or obstructs the passage of vehicles or pedestrians or interfere with a street lamp, a competent authority may issue a notice to the hedge owner to remove the cause of the danger, obstruction or interference.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chetwynd Road, Dartmouth Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trees suffering from drought, 21st June
item.description:
The new trees on Sewdley St, E5 0AX and within the borough are NOT being watered during the hot spell and are therefore suffering from drought
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Sewdley Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead and damaged trees in Sandringham Road, 21st June
item.description:
There is a dead tree outside No. 8 Sandringham Road. There are other trees further up the road which are severely damaged - possibly as a result of the drought a few years ago. One tree outside No. 14 has previously already been removed. While those cherry trees look nice when they are in bloom, they might not be most suitable for the area. We urgently need replacement / healthy trees in this street. The street is something of a heat collector, and the front gardens are too small to plant trees.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sandringham Road, Sundridge, London
Report on FixMyStreet
